website_summaries.verdict: Well-made with a traditional design, this fork is an all-purpose tool.
pros: With a wood handle and shaft, this is the fork for a traditionalist
Lacquered handle with D-grip offers balance and control
Strength and durability of the tines make it a good tool for everyday use in the garden
cons: A few users experienced a broken handle after only using the spade a few times

customer_reviews.title: Handle is crooked!!!
customer_reviews.text: the handle is attached way off from the direction of the fork part of this tool!!! a defect so obvious, how this got past any quality control ..... what were they thinking! now I need to waste more time to get it wrapped up again and get it sent back.
customer_reviews.author: Renie

customer_reviews.title: I go through gardening forks pretty quickly.
customer_reviews.text: I go through gardening forks pretty quickly....hit a rock or a root, bending a tine or separating the fork from the handle. I have had this for over a year and use it for at least 5-10 hours a week during spring, summer and fall. Still holding up to my constant use and typical lack of care (leaving it in the garden stuck in the soil most of the time).
customer_reviews.author: Book lover

customer_reviews.title: Buy a stainless steel product instead of this!
customer_reviews.text: One tong broke off the first time I used the fork. I continued to use the tool due to need. Within an hour I was down to two tongs. I would recommend spending an extra $10 for a stainless steel product if you have any kind of dried-out or hard soil issues. This fork might work to turn soft compost, but that's about it.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: It's a good size for the application
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to turn material in compost bins. It's a good size for the application. I found a chunky splinter sticking out where the wood handle was forced into the metal shank, which, over time would have been problematic (I shaved off with utility knife). And the forks are flat rather than spiked. But I needed this right away, so I am making due and getting used to the tool. Over priced with a need for better quality control.
customer_reviews.author: TrykaTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The shorter handle makes it easy to get on top of
customer_reviews.text: This is my most used tool in the garden! For lifting bulbs, double digging new beds, quick transplants, flipping compost.... The shorter handle makes it easy to get on top of, and since its a fork it takes a lot less effort to get into the soil vs a shovel. Seems very well built and its already gone through a lot of abuse this year. If it ever breaks, I will be ordering another one immediately!
customer_reviews.author: Carey

customer_reviews.title: Good all-purpose garden fork.
customer_reviews.text: Great little all purpose fork. Too small to be a dedicated hay fork, not strong enough to turn hard ground, but excellent at breaking up dirt clods, turning the compost pile or digging potatoes. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Earl D Walker

customer_reviews.title: It's a pretty good spading fork.
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty happy with this spading fork. It bent a little bit the first time I used it but we were able to straighten it back out. I was thinning out daylilies and when I tried to dig up a clump of them, there was a tree root in the way and the fork caught on it and I pried a little too hard. I'm going to have to be more careful because this is a medium duty fork, not a heavy duty one. I sure hope it doesn't bend easier now.
customer_reviews.author: HobbyJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Good deal
customer_reviews.text: Bought for turning over the compost and it works very well and has been a huge help. A little pricey but compared to others of the same quality it is a good deal.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't find in town!
customer_reviews.text: Love this fork: heavy for serious digging/ transplanting. Mush easier in clay than a shovel!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Alice J C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect spading fork.
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I needed for doing some deep, loosening digging in my garden. The soil here has a 4" or 5" thick layer of very thick clay, about 4" down. I also had lily bulbs I wanted to dig up without damaging them. This made the work much easier than either a spade or shovel ever could have done. Very well made and sturdy enough to last the rest of my lifetime. I can highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Audrey Stone

customer_reviews.title: Well made
customer_reviews.text: Yes, this is well made but I’ve never found one that can stand up to my abuse in our Georgia clay filled with rocks and roots. I’m using this one gently and resorting to a pickax for the really difficult jobs.
customer_reviews.author: NonnaB

customer_reviews.title: A better spading fork
customer_reviews.text: My wife uses these items to dig up bushes for transplanting. She's gone through two other brands breaking the metal where the tynes meet the handle. This looks sturdier so far and has not bent or snapped.
customer_reviews.author: robert fox

customer_reviews.title: Spading Fork
customer_reviews.text: Wow did this make turning my garden easier! Love it, much better price than the depot. The shorter handle make it easier for me to use, being a bit short myself. Using this cut the time to turn the garden to 1/3 of what it used to be. We have hot wet weather this time of year as our gardens rest in the summer, so the soil turning is hard work. This tool appears to be well made and perfect for the job.
customer_reviews.author: LCA

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tool!
customer_reviews.text: I've always liked this brand and have been very happy with the quality of the tools
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The price has gone up since I bought it but its a good product.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this garden fork for about 3 years now and this year the fork finally separated from the handle. When that happens (about 2x's now) I just push it back in and keep working. The tongs have never bent or broken, even when I have encountered roots and rocks in the soil. The price has gone up since I bought it but its a good product.
customer_reviews.author: MR. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy pitch fork
customer_reviews.text: I garden and have had problems with the tines of my pitch fork bending as I try to dig up roots of tiger lillies or hostas to transplant. This pitch fork is much sturdier and does not give at all. I always had to bend back the tines of my pitch fork and this one is so strong and resilient.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah Schohn

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is really sturdy and works well. Have been using it daily for a few months to feed animals and break ice
customer_reviews.author: June Peppers

customer_reviews.title: Review
customer_reviews.text: Looks good but most just do not last. This one looks sturdy but only time will tell. Hopes are high but integrity in manufacturing has reach a new low. I hope it’s great. I’m a Retired Master Gareener I’ll put it to the test.
customer_reviews.author: john milu truesdale

customer_reviews.title: Great for digging in circles
customer_reviews.text: Handle and spade fork do not line up with each other. Product description should include great for digging in circles
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: Handle broke after digging three holes very poor quality The wood handle could have had a fracture that could not be seen by the human eye.
customer_reviews.author: David Smith

customer_reviews.title: Nice quality workmanship
customer_reviews.text: This was the perfect replacement for my ancient one. The height and weight are just right. The tines are strong.
customer_reviews.author: S. E.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Fork teeth so short it is for a child not fit for a adult
customer_reviews.author: Do

customer_reviews.title: Solid and Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Spading Fork that was solid and sturdy with a wooden handle not plastic. This one really feels good in the garden. Very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: Ray W.

customer_reviews.title: Good garden tool
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to turn dirt in my garden. It is easy to work with as it is not as heavy as my old Spade fork. Pleased with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: sturdy, good tines and lite weght
customer_reviews.text: I love a pitch fork for weeding. I am able to insert the tines and losen the grass/weeds w/o hurting my plant roots. Fabulous tool.
customer_reviews.author: MaryWyoming1

customer_reviews.title: Great. Good design
customer_reviews.text: Great. Good design, well made. Does many jobs easily - breaking up dirt, clearing tough brush. Be mindful of the height (or is it length) measurement. If buying again, I'd get a little bigger handle.
customer_reviews.author: RK

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Don't know why I waited so long ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Don't know why I waited so long to get a spading fork. It works great and makes turning over the soil and weed removal so much easier.
customer_reviews.author: BuckeyeChemist

customer_reviews.title: Not for someone 6 ft or taller!
customer_reviews.text: Works as designed. Just a bit too short for me.
customer_reviews.author: MillyG

customer_reviews.title: Quality control is sorely lacking
customer_reviews.text: The fork is probably fine but it arrived brand new with a bent tine. Was not damaged in transit. Quality control apparently sucks including the marketeer.
customer_reviews.author: Carol S.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: So far this has held up very well. I have removed 3 rather large bushes by patiently prying them up. It is a nice weight and holds up well. It should be good for harvesting potatoes also since the tines are rounded.
customer_reviews.author: debadventurer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my compost bin
customer_reviews.text: I use this to turn compost in the bin and love it. It is strong and easy to handle for someone who is 5'1".
customer_reviews.author: Debby T.

customer_reviews.title: My father loves this tool
customer_reviews.text: To my surprise the tines are reinforced on the back side making it sturdier than other similar forks I have seen in big box stores.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and ergonomic for me.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to lift compost and shredded wood chips and it's working great. It's sturdy and comfortable to use. Quality !!
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: A good heavy duty tool all gardeners need!
customer_reviews.text: I'm hard put to come up with a rave review for a pitchfork. What can I say other than it's well made and has stood up fine with some heavy use this summer. A must tool for any kind of gardening.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra L.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Too heavy, Too Flat, Too Narrow
customer_reviews.text: Design is too flat and narrow so you end up getting less material with each dig in. The tines are too thick so it’s hard to dig in. Heavy and tiring.
customer_reviews.author: BK

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't find a reasonably priced short handle locally. I'll rarely use it so I didn't want to spend too much yet I'm happy with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: D. R. leeTop Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I think my fear of ot breaking is after reading the reviews. We moved into a home where the ground has not been touched for 8 years. This little fellow works better than my shovel
customer_reviews.author: Miriam Menon

customer_reviews.title: Gardening Made Easier
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a sturdy tool. Wood handle is substantial enough to hold up to rough use and the fork is well constructed. Excellent tool for a nice price!
customer_reviews.author: TJ Ohio

customer_reviews.title: Nice spade
customer_reviews.text: Strong tines, well put together spade. I have one that is very old and this new one has parts that look just as durable. I use it for digging potatoes and I expect it to outlast me.
customer_reviews.author: David Bosard

customer_reviews.title: Value for dollar
customer_reviews.text: This 85 year old lady especially likes the height and weight. I'm using it mostly to air the soil under my many trees and bushes - particularly the eucalyptus. Great tool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It was smaller than I thought it would be. ...
customer_reviews.text: It was smaller than I thought it would be. Quality seems ok. No complaints other than size. Seems smaller than the average size in the stores around here.
customer_reviews.author: wip

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: First time I tried in un-tilled soil the forks bent, not real strong steel.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Garden fork delivers as promised.
customer_reviews.text: My favorite garden tool along with scratcher. With these 2 items I can almost do without others in Florida. Nice quality, I like.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A

customer_reviews.title: It does the trick
customer_reviews.text: I just needed it to turn my compost heap, and it works wonderfully. The shaft is strong, the fork is coated with this protectant, I suppose to keep it from rusting, etc. It's great, and a great value.
customer_reviews.author: BojiBolas

customer_reviews.title: Truper 30293 Tru Tough Spading Fork, 4-Tine, D-Handle, 30-Inch
customer_reviews.text: I needed a spading fork for lifting piles of leaves and grass into trash bags or wheel barrels. This one is working fine and has held up nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy D.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fork for turning soil
customer_reviews.text: Very nice fork for turning soil. Mine started to rust a bite when I put it outside- it was my fault though.
customer_reviews.author: adebunmi

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent tool
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent tool, but nothing spectualr. Not for heavy soils. I would consider this a light to medium duty tool.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good quality. perfect for working my compost bins
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty, good quality. perfect for working my compost bins
customer_reviews.author: Vivian

customer_reviews.title: Great fork at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: This has been my #1 garden tool since I got it. Light weight and easy to handle.
customer_reviews.author: Johnfam

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool! Will NEVER be without one again
customer_reviews.text: Awesome tool! Will NEVER be without one again. Sturdily made and works fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrie A. Stieberitz

customer_reviews.title: A-OK
customer_reviews.text: It works fine. It looks like the handle is durable and I have already dug some of the season potatoes. Thanks - ron
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Naumann

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and well built. Met my expectations and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon D. Howe

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Taters didn't care to be dug up ,but we did it anyway !
customer_reviews.author: Wilbur Elliott

customer_reviews.title: great size
customer_reviews.text: Easily turns the compost pile or great for digging potatoes in the garden.. Sturdy and well built and not too big or heavy .
customer_reviews.author: p.annie

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time and is a solid tool. I purchased it to work on turning my compost pile and it has functioned well.
customer_reviews.author: Peter P. Gatineau

customer_reviews.title: It is not a professionally graded product but can do ...
customer_reviews.text: It is not a professionally graded product but can do a decent job if used for light usage in the garden.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: Fork easily bent
customer_reviews.text: You really have to baby this so it doesn't get bent out of shape. Not too tough. Probably ok for loose soil but nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: R. Singer

customer_reviews.title: Like It
customer_reviews.text: It's ok I'll work with it, I think the price is right and one good thing about it is that it is guaranteed for life.how can you loose
customer_reviews.author: Ora Powell

customer_reviews.title: Not Sturdy !
customer_reviews.text: It is not as sturdy as it was advertised and the tines bending with a minimal us... D handle is not appropriate and it moves during use... I'd like to get a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Wateranalyst

customer_reviews.title: I am pleased with the quality of all of the components
customer_reviews.text: I have not used this Spading Fork, I was planning ahead when I bought it for my Fall Harvest. It appears to be well made, light enough to handle and not too heavy to be difficult to work with. I am pleased with the quality of all of the components.
customer_reviews.author: Garden Rose

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY
customer_reviews.text: snapped in ahfla fter about 15m of standard use. really cheap handle
customer_reviews.author: Cooper Lyon

customer_reviews.title: happy
customer_reviews.text: It is such a help with spring flowerbed digging, invading grass comes up much easier. I also use it to turn over garden beds.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Anderton

customer_reviews.title: None of the Home Improvement/Garden Shops carry a SHORT fork ...
customer_reviews.text: None of the Home Improvement/Garden Shops carry a SHORT fork anymore. This is exactly what my 5'2' wife likes for her gardening!
customer_reviews.author: farrsim

customer_reviews.title: Great compost fork
customer_reviews.text: Durable and well made. I use it to turn compost and general yard work. Id guess it would work up to about 45ish pounds of load before bending. Better quality than my local home improvement cavern. Hey it's a big fork! What else can I say?
customer_reviews.author: Cliff

customer_reviews.title: A well made product.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to use the fork but it looks substantial. Everything pertaining to the order was as promised. It is good to deal with people who do as they say they will. This is, however, the third time this review has been written. There won't be another one. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne King

customer_reviews.title: Pitchfork of Doom.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pitchfork for standing next to a bald guy and posing, while trying to look as unhappy and as stuffy as possible. Well suited for that purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Stewart

product_meta.title: Truper 30293 Tru Tough Spading Fork, 4-Tine, D-Handle, 30-Inch
product_meta.description: Truper 30293 Tru Tough Spading Fork, 4-Tine, D-Handle, 30-Inch
feature_bullets: BJ-4E, 30-inch North American ash, lacquered handle with d-grip for balance and control
Spray clean with garden hose, coat with silicone spray
Truper 30293, tru-tough: trupers best selling signature tool line

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars167 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
